name: Godsmack
description:
'''Godsmack''' is an American [[Rock music|rock]] band from [[Lawrence, Massachusetts]], formed in 1995. The band is currently composed of lead singer and rhythm guitarist [[Sully Erna]] and bassist [[Robbie Merrill]]. Since its formation, Godsmack has released nine studio albums, one EP (''[[The Other Side (Godsmack EP)|The Other Side]]''), four DVDs, one compilation album (''[[Good Times, Bad Times... Ten Years of Godsmack]]''), and one live album (''[[Live & Inspired]]''). Their final album, ''[[Lighting Up the Sky]]'', was released in 2023.

Since its inception, Godsmack has toured with [[Ozzfest]] on more than one occasion and has toured with many other large tours and festivals, including supporting its albums with its own arena tours. They have released three consecutive number-one albums (''[[Faceless (Godsmack album)|Faceless]]'', ''[[IV (Godsmack album)|IV]]'' and ''[[The Oracle (Godsmack album)|The Oracle]]'') on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], and have had 25 top-ten [[Mainstream Rock (chart)|rock radio hits]] and 12 at number one. In honor of the band's success and the release of their sixth studio album, ''[[1000hp (album)|1000hp]]'', Mayor [[Marty Walsh]] declared August 6 as "Godsmack Day" in the city of [[Boston]].
